p: The structure of fucoidan (FF) from F. vesiculosus was last reviewed by Patankar et al. [ 6]. It was suggested that it possesses a central core formed by α-L-fucose (1,3)-linked, sulfated at C4. In addition, several branching points (every two or three fucose residues) were present in α-(1,2) or α-(1,4)-linked, on the main chain.
